job_tasks.phrase: Design, develop, and maintain automated testing frameworks and systems.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core software engineering task of building and maintaining systems, specifically for testing.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with development teams to write comprehensive unit tests.
job_tasks.justification: Writing unit tests is a fundamental software development activity, and collaboration with development teams is a common aspect of this.

job_tasks.phrase: Participate in the continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) processes.
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to involvement in CI/CD pipelines, which falls under the operations and deployment aspect of software engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Analyze test results, troubleshoot issues, and improve the areas of weakness in our applications.
job_tasks.justification: Analyzing results, troubleshooting, and improving applications are all core software development and maintenance tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: Work closely with other engineers and product managers to ensure that all aspects of quality are being addressed throughout the software development lifecycle.
job_tasks.justification: This describes collaboration within the software development lifecycle, focusing on quality assurance, which is an integrated part of development.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop and execute automated tests to ensure product quality.
job_tasks.justification: Developing and executing tests is a software development task aimed at ensuring product quality.

job_tasks.phrase: Design and implement testing tools and frameworks to automate test processes.
job_tasks.justification: This is a software development task focused on creating tools and frameworks for automation.

job_tasks.phrase: Enhance and maintain excellent test coverage throughout the software development lifecycle.
job_tasks.justification: Maintaining and enhancing test coverage is a software development responsibility within the lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with development teams to understand new features and create appropriate testing strategies.
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding new features (development context) and creating strategies, which is part of the software development process.

job_tasks.phrase: Report, track, and manage any discovered defects.
job_tasks.justification: Defect management is a crucial part of the software development lifecycle, ensuring quality and stability.

job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions developing CI/CD pipelines for testing services before deployment, which aligns with operations and MLOps.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses entirely on Software Development & Integration (Macro-Category A) and Operations & MLOps (Macro-Category A). There are no tasks or responsibilities related to AI Specialization (Macro-Category B), such as model development, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, or RAG. The role is clearly defined as an SDET/QA Engineer, which is a software engineering function.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the responsibilities of an SDET/QA Engineer. It explicitly lists traditional software engineering and testing tasks, with no mention of AI/ML specific responsibilities, making the classification straightforward.
